p: RÃ©union island, a French volcanic overseas department belonging to the Mascarene Archipelago (Indian Ocean), has never been connected to any other landmasses [ 1] and is described as one of the 36 world biodiversity hotspots [ 2]. It displays a wide and rich flora with a high percentage of endemic species. Many of the indigenous and endemic plants from Reunion island have been and are still used for traditional medicine [ 3]. Although some studies have reported the potential therapeutic effects of these plants in combatting hypertension [ 4], oxidative stress, inflammation [ 5], parasitosis (i.e., plasmodium), and viruses (i.e., Chikungunya, Dengue, and Zika) [ 6, 7, 8], their deep content characterization as well as their real efficiency in vivo remains largely unknown.
